dataPolicy.tuv_KE:
[last updated 05-10-2020]

Thua Emsalaba areng'an a Kenya (KRCS) ka NLRC kithaki aking'it ethi ng'akiro kon atanyunet a akin aking'arakino. Itorunu aking'arakino na na diit. Kithubi nu eng'arakinata ebuku kuth lu idoporit akolong' noi.

King'ithi iyong nuku;
  • Ekiro kon LA eking'aren, lo nyiarei ka la ng'uuni
  • password (ethakio ng'anambae ngwomon)
  • nkaru kon
  • adakar/ere
  • nyo ithubete taanyut akimuj
  • Iyei a king'arakino a ng'aropiai or akimuj iting'it tokona
  • a namba a diit
.

Ikechakinio ng'akiro kon niajokon ana computer a NLRC ainakithi KRCS ka ebuku lokuthi atanyuneta ainakin ng'itung'a lo ichamit einakinio.

Inanyuni "Twilio" a namba kon kigirak SMS.

Iyanyuni "Africa's Talking" a namba kon kigirak SMS kitheutae.

Epuduri ana king'arakino kana ti ethaki na kiputa ng'akiro kon. King'it loking'arakinto ni ikokinio.

Keya ni ethaki aking'ita, King'it luking'arakinto.
dataPolicy.en:
[last updated 05-10-2020]

We, The Kenya Red Cross Society (KRCS) and The Netherlands Red Cross (NLRC) need to ask you the information below in order to provide cash aid. This will be done using M-PESA mobile money. We do this to help the people in your community who are most affected by drought.

We will ask you your:
  • First name, second name & third name
  • Password (4 numbers you will need to create)
  • Age group
  • Village/Area
  • Current livelihood strategy
  • If you are currently receiving aid
  • Phone number


This information will be stored securely on an NLRC computer and shared with KRCS and your community to ensure a fair inclusion process.

Twilio will receive your number to send an sms.

Africa's Talking will receive your number to send a code (if you are included).

You can leave the aid program and delete your personal information at any time. Please ask the Aid worker how.

If you have more questions, please ask the Aid worker.

aboutProgram.tuv_KE:
Aking'arakino na aka akamu. Epediri aking'arakino ng'akaithi 350 atoma Kipsing ori Oldonyiro.

Taanyuneia Atheuno

Achamakin ebuku kuth I atamar ng'itunga lomenen kechi arai:
  • ng'aberu ng'aputher, na achakar ka ni itanekete teting'ito ng'ide lo eya kop ng'ikaru 5 tamam ibere iting'it.
  • Akai
    • Nkolia lo erikito ng'aberu naputheru kana achakar tamamu ebere eting'ito
    • ng'akaithi a itung'unan anikadekan
    • nkaithi ne Iya ng'ide lu irogoit tiya kop ng'ikaru 5.
    • Kigiritae najore a HSNP group 2
  • Lu emam ibore:
    • Ng'itunga lu ipakaritae alobuku kotere ng'italio
    • Ng'itunga lo eporothi ng'ikaru 60


Lomenen noi ethi ewolikinio eking'aren. Lope ni Ng'arakinio.

Kotere nyo nkiwakinere

Kiyei epei e lol kon lo;
  • egirtae lokathi
  • etigit ebesherea
  • eyanyunini aking'arakino ache a ng'aropiai or akimuj

Kwani kinakinere ng'aropiai

Itorunete M-PESA.

Ne Etia Ng'aropiai

Iputori mara ng'arei Kshs 4500.
Tarata daang' KES 9000.

Ori Ipoterere

Ne eking'aren ekap lu ng'itomon ka epei.2020.
Na ng'arei. Elap a ng'itomon ka nyiarei. 2020
aboutProgram.en:
This is an aid program for drought response. It aims to help a total of 350 households with income support in [LOCATION A] or [LOCATION B].

Inclusion criteria

Your community has agreed that the most vulnerable in your community are:
  • Widowed, divorced, pregnant or lactating women with children under 5 years of age who have no source of income
  • Household:
    • Headed by widows or divorced women with no income
    • Headed by chronically ill such as people who are terminal
    • With severely malnourished child(ren) under 5 years of age
    • Listed under Hunger Safety Net Programme (HSNP) group 2
  • Poor and vulnerable:
    • culturally/socially discriminated special interest groups
    • people of over 60 years


The more vulnerable you are the higher you will be prioritized for assistance

Exclusion criteria

To be eligible you or someone from your household should not:
  • be employed in the formal sector
  • be owning a business
  • currently receive cash transfers or food aid

Cash Transfer Mechanism

This aid program uses M-Pesa

Transfer Amount

2 payments of 4500 KES
Total 9000 KES

Timeline

Payment 1: Due November 2020
Payment 2: Due December 2020
